summary: The HIDTA Enhancement Act (S. 767) amends the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998, focusing on fentanyl and fentanyl-related substances. It mandates reports on HIDTA fund use for investigations and prosecutions. The bill also revises funding, tasking the Attorney General to provide resources for investigation and prosecution, including temporary reassignment of assistant U.S. attorneys. It increases funding and details how to improve the ability of high intensity drug trafficking areas to meet their goals. It also adds new purposes for the director.
